alert.note: Alert for Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Dense Fog Advisory issued January 28 at 10:46PM PST until January 29 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PST MONDAY... ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility less than a quarter of a mile in dense fog. For the High Wind Watch, southeast winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 65 mph possible. * WHERE...Jackson County. * WHEN...For the Dense Fog Advisory, until 9 AM PST Monday. For the High Wind Watch, from late Tuesday night through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow for plenty of room between you and other vehicles. * Fog makes objects appear farther away than they are * Use low beams. High beams reflect back thick fog, making visibility worse for you and other drivers. * Be prepared. Keep your headlights clean. That way, you`re ready for low-visibility conditions * Don`t use cruise control. Most crashes occur because the driver is going too fast for weather conditions.
